body_text: From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia South Korean record label Record label Studio Blu Founded 2018 Founder Stone Music Entertainment Defunct August 2021 Distributor(s) Stone Music Entertainment Genre K-pop R&B Indie Hip hop Country of origin South Korea Studio Blu ( Korean : 스튜디오블루) was an in-house label founded in 2018 by Stone Music Entertainment. In August 2021, the label was integrated with other CJ ENM labels as Wake One . History [ edit ] Studio Blu was founded in 2018, and houses artists such as Heize , Mia, DAVII and Truedy. $ammy joined the company in 2019. It was announced that 3 years after their disbandment, I.O.I was set to return in December 2019, potentially with all 11 original members, and will be co-managed by Swing Entertainment and Studio Blu. [ 1 ] [ 2 ] However, the comeback has been virtually canceled due to scheduling conflicts between the members and the ongoing Produce investigations. [ 3 ] Former artists [ edit ] I.O.I (2019) (co-managed with Swing Entertainment ) Lim Na-young (2019) Kim Chung-ha (2019) Kim Se-jeong (2019) Jung Chae-yeon (2019) Zhou Jieqiong (2019) Kim So-hye (2019) Choi Yoo-jung (2019) Kang Mi-na (2019) Kim Do-yeon (2019) Heize (2018–2020) [ 4 ] DAVII [ 5 ] Mia [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Truedy $ammy [ 8 ] Studio Blu on Instagram Studio Blu on Facebook Retrieved from " https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Studio_Blu&oldid=1165863700 " Categories : Companies based in Seoul K-pop record labels South Korean record labels Talent agencies of South Korea Entertainment companies established in 2018 Record labels established in 2018 Hidden categories: CS1 Korean-language sources (ko) Articles with short description Short description is different from Wikidata
